snippet: Ali Akbar Salehi, Iran’s foreign minister, restated a call for direct talks with Washington, but his comments were viewed as more atmospheric than definitive.
abstract: Ali Akbar Salehi, Iran's foreign minister, says that Iran is open to renewed offer of direct talks with United States on its nuclear program and that it looks favorably on proposal for new round of multilateral nuclear negotiations.
lead_paragraph: Ali Akbar Salehi, Iran’s foreign minister, restated a call for direct talks with Washington, but his comments were viewed as more atmospheric than definitive.

headline.seo: Iran Said to Be Open to Proposed New Nuclear Talks
headline.main: Official Says Iran Is Open to New Round of Nuclear Talks
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Foreign Minister Suggests Openness Toward New Nuclear Negotiations

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
